introduction: The following passage is adapted from The Soul of a New Machine by Tracy Kidder (1981).
text: Kidder tells the story of a team of engineers working on the development of a groundbreaking minicomputer in the late 1970s. The project required extraordinary dedication and innovation, with team members often sacrificing personal time to meet tight deadlines. Their work ______ the rapid advancements in computer technology that revolutionized industries and reshaped modern life.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Pay close attention to subject-verb agreement and verb tense consistency, ensuring the choice aligns logically with the historical narrative.
explanation: Choice A is the best answer. The present perfect has symbolized reflects the ongoing significance of the engineers' work, connecting their past achievements to their lasting impact on modern technology. Choice B is incorrect because the present tense symbolizes suggests the action is occurring now, rather than reflecting on historical achievements with ongoing relevance. Choice C is incorrect because the participle symbolizing does not form a complete verb for the sentence, making it incomplete. Choice D is incorrect because the past tense symbolized confines the meaning to the past, ignoring the lasting importance of the work.
